recordings.loc: Czarna Białostocka (near  Gmina Czarna Białostocka), białostocki, Podlaskie Voivodeship

recordings.rmk: Krruu-krruu flight call and drawn-out call after landing.

This contact call carries far through a woodland and can be associated with the flight call once the bird has landed. There is much variation in the frequency of calling reflecting the degree of excitement. Each call is  0.7 to 0.9 seconds in length. It is often given at intervals while foraging and also as an anxiety call to warn nestlings of possible danger from a predator.
The sonagram for this call can be found in the monograph of the species by renowned woodpecker expert Gerard Gorman.

Advertising call given from a tree – Adult male, Bukk Hills. The first note is clearly longer than the others and has a slightly delayed interval between it and the next note gives the impression of the call speeding up, before developing a steady rhythm. Not uncommonly the last two or three notes may have slight yet noticeably increased intervals as the call winds down.
The sonagram for this call can be found in the monograph of the species by renowned woodpecker expert Gerard Gorman.

This adult bird called as it flew away from the recordist through broad leaf woodland in the Bukk Hills National Park. 
The sonagram for this call can be found in the monograph of the species by renowned woodpecker expert Gerard Gorman.
Same bird as on XC135163.

feeding

specific territorial voice to individuals from Bieszczady mountains, normally in the region, it takes about 5 minutes but may take up to 15 minutes, with frequently more thann 100 sylabs, what diferenting this birds from lowland birds
Female
The drawn-out landing call.

Bird also seen. Averages over three drums: drum duration = 2.04s; nr of taps per drum = 36; nr of taps per sec = 17.6. Drum is too long for other woodpeckers with the possible exception of Green and Grey-headed, but it is much more powerful than these. Speed is just a bit slower than Great Spotted, but not as slow as Three-toed.

recordings.file-name: XC506854-4 -Głos kontaktowy samca do samicy przed zmianą w wysiadywaniu.  Autor nagr. Edward Niezgoda.mp3
recordings.rmk:
Środowisko- teren pofałdowany u podnóża stoku wzniesienia, w pobliżu  przepływa strumyk wodny na obrzeżach którego są pojedyncze drzewa martwe oraz złomy wszystkich drzew. Drzewostan mieszany, łęgowo - grądowy z płatem drzew jodłowych, pojedynczymi: sosny, jodły, buka w wieku 10-60-100 lat. Zachowanie ptaków: samiec głosem kontaktowo -
 alarmowym oznajmia samicy swój przylot do zmiany w  wysiadywaniu. Ptak dorosły w dobrej kondycji, zaczepiony na pniu drzewa w pozycji pionowej, w wieku powyżej dwóch lat. Warunki atmosferyczne dobre, temperatura 18 stopni Celsjusza.

recordings.loc: Hugona Kołłątaja Dworzec autobusowy (near  Jasło), jasielski, Województwo podkarpackie
recordings.file-name: XC506853-41 -Głosy  kontaktowe,terytorialny,samca przed wylotem piskląt z dziupli.   Autor nagr. Edward Niezgoda.mp3
recordings.rmk: Ptak widziany. Nagranie głosu na żywo, rejestratorem cyfrowym. Środowisko - pofałdowany teren górski poza doliną, miejscami o grząskich powierzchniach. Rejon drzew z dziuplami, poprzecinany ciekami wodnymi, od dna których wznoszą się stoki spadziste i strome. Drzewostan wielogatunkowy: grądowo - łęgowy. Zachowanie ptaka- przeloty samca w rejonie dziupli lęgowej z wydawanymi głosami zachęcającymi pisklęta do wylotu z dziupli, odzewy piskląt w dziupli. Ptak dorosły- w dobrej kondycji, samiec. Dzień pogodny, temperatura +26 stopni Celsjusza.

recordings.file-name: XC505715-68 -Werblowanie - bębnienie samicy po odlocie od karmienia piskląt- deszcz.   Autor nagr. Edward Niezgoda.mp3
recordings.rmk: Nagranie głosu w terenie leśnym na żywo rejestratorem cyfrowym na żywo  w  warunkach padającego deszczu . Środowisko: teren pofałdowany z małymi ceikami wodnymi od strony S z strumykiem wodnym. Drzewostan:  bór mieszany, buczyna karpacka , jodła, sosna oraz drzewa łęgowo-gradowe. Drzewa w wieku 10-60-100 lat. Dziuple dzięcioła czarnego w drzewach bukowych. Wygląd: ptak dorosły  w dobrej kondycji samica, wiek powyżej 2 lat. Pogoda: zachmurzenie duże z opadami deszczu : temperatura +13 stopni.

recordings.loc: Gmina Brzyska (near  Brzyska), jasielski, Województwo podkarpackie
recordings.file-name: XC505710-59 -Przylot, głosy kontaktowe samicy , przed  zmianą samca w kutej nowej dziupli.   Autor nagr. Edward Niezgoda.mp3
recordings.rmk: Nagranie na żywo rejestratorem cyfrowym koło drzewa bukowego w którym kuta była nowa dziupla przez dzięcioły czarne . Środowisko: teren pofałdowany u podnóża wzniesienia w pobliżu strumyk wodny . Drzewostan mieszany : łęgowo- gradowy z płatami drzew jodłowych, pojedynczymi : sosny, buka  w  wieku 10- 60 - 100 lat. w drzewostanie są drzewa obumarłe, martwe oraz złomy oraz leżanina wszystkich drzew .  Kucie nowej dziupli w drzewie bukowym poniżej rosnących bocznych gałęzi . Zachowanie ptaków: głos przylotu i kontaktowy samicy przed zmianą samca w kutej nowej dziupli. Wygląd:  ptaki dorosłe w  wieku powyżej 2 lat w dobrej kondycji : samiec i samica. Warunki atmosferyczne dobre , temperatura dnia +8 stopni. Nagrane głosy określają zachowanie i czas zmiany dzięciołów czarnych podczas kucia nowej dziupli.

recordings.loc: Gmina Brzyska (near  Brzyska), jasielski, Województwo podkarpackie
recordings.type: adult, female, flight call, male, song
recordings.file-name: XC505708-57 -Odzewy godowe w zajętym rewirze,głosy, stuki, loty, śpiewy.   Autor nagr. Edward Niezgoda.mp3
recordings.rmk: Nagranie głosu w terenie leśnym na żywo , rejestratorem cyfrowym. Środowisko- teren pofałdowany z ciekami wodnymi, miejscami zagłębienia o grząskiej powierzchni w których są martwe drzewa i złomy różnych gatunków drzew. Drzewostan świeży : jodła, sosna, buk, modrzew , zwarcie drzewostanu umiarkowane , miejscowo luźne w rejonie drzew z dziuplami przerywane. Drzewa w wieku : 10 - 80- 120 lat. Dziuple w drzewach bukowych .  Zachowanie ptaka : przylot pary ptaków  w rejon zajętego rewiru,  po wydawanych głosach , stukach, śpiewie odlot w teren leśny. Ptaki dorosłe w dobrej kondycji w  wieku 3-5 lat, samiec i samica. Warunki atmosferyczne: pogodnie +5 stopni . Oświetlenie dobre. Wszystkie głosy , stuki, śpiew nagrane podczas przylotu tych ptaków nie można rozdzielać bo  zachowanie  ich w zajętym rewirze  będzie niekompletne (zafałszowane ).
Mainly coniferous forest, high pass filter 1000 Hz 6 dB, ZOOM H1n.

recordings.loc: Augsburg, Siebentischwald, east of past Behringer Hof
recordings.rmk:
"song? & territorral call"  --  in mixed forest with  low trees and bushes -- sound was trapped (all birds seen:NO!!) ...habi:'TANNE1-GePu1-REWE'    ----

 ----- i tryed to record sound of moult-time in the wood ...i fastened for that 4 days my recorder at a low young tree.

> when i was at this place at 22.07.17 morning... nearly the only birds i heard, were juv. Phylloscopus collybita with their adults - and there was strong calm of birds in the forest.

-- ....but when my recorder was alone in this habitat we hear quiet a lot of birds --and when in this seldom entered place... were people these days... the birds stopped singing and calling immediately for 1 hour and longer!

....>>> generally noted to moult: "The birds stop singing. Most birds already did, or sing infrequent. ---- Mating, nesting, breeding, feeding, caring. Exhausted. --- Renew worn plumage. --- Moult, fattening up for migration or the coming winter. ----- No need, no energy, no time to sing.

Apart from silence, the only new sounds this time of year are those of juveniles and of some birds already returning from up north".

recordings.loc: Serrada di Folgaria, Trento, Trentino-Alto Adige
Augsburg, Siebentischwald, east of past Behringer Hof
recordings.rmk:
"..& territoral call"  --  in mixed forest -- sound was trapped ...habi:'TANNE1-REWE'     

-----      i tryed to record sound of moult-time in the wood ...i fastened for that 4 days my recorder at a low branch of a spruce (the wind in the tree is sometimes stronger to hear, sorry) > when i was at this place at 22.07.17 morning... nearly the only birds i heard, were juv. Phylloscopus collybita with their adults - and there was strong calm of birds in the forest. 

-- ....but when my recorder was alone in this habitat we hear quiet a lot of birds --and when in this seldom entered place... were people these days... the birds stopped singing and calling immediately for 1 hour and longer!

....>>> generally noted to moult: "The birds stop singing. Most birds already did, or sing infrequent. 
---- Mating, nesting, breeding, feeding, caring. Exhausted.  --- Renew worn plumage. --- Moult, fattening up for migration or the coming winter. ----- No need, no energy, no time to sing. 

Apart from silence, the only new sounds this time of year are those of juveniles and of some birds already returning from up north".

recordings.loc: Mława (near  Mlawa), Mława County, Masovian Voivodeship

recordings.rmk: Perched in the crown of a tall deciduous tree. Mixed forest.
Black Woodpecker in low flight over mixed forest, prompting a perched one to sing. Then both are calling back and forth, first from a distance, then closer together. Gender unknown (rivals? pair?).

The recording was not modified. Two Black Woodpeckers responded to one another, one of them being perched nearby, high in a tree within a gallery forest along the Danube River. Probably two recently fledged juveniles.

A pair of birds in deciduous woods (beech and oak).
A pair of birds in deciduous woods (beech and oak).

Green or black woodpecker (Picus viridis/Dryocopus martius)? Female black woodpecker? "Laughter" type call. Bird seen, but not well enough for visual identification. This recording is member of a set of recordings all made the same morning in the same decidious forest in farmland, but It could still potentially be several individuals potentially belonging to different species. Other members of the same set are XC346481, XC346483 and XC346484.

Green or black woodpecker (Picus viridis/Dryocopus martius)? Female black woodpecker? Three types of call: "Eagle-like call" 00:01, "Jackdaw-like call" 00:08, and "laughter" 00:16. Bird seen, but not well enough for visual identification. This recording is member of a set of recordings all made the same morning in the same decidious forest in farmland, but It could still potentially be several individuals potentially belonging to different species. Other members of the same set are XC346481, XC346484 and XC346485.

White-backed woodpecker (Dendrocopos leucotos) or Black woodpecker (Dryocopus martius)? Female black woodpecker? Drumming at 00:01, 00:49, 01:26. Bird seen, but not well enough for visual identification. This recording is member of a set of recordings all made the same morning in the same decidious forest in farmland, but It could still potentially be several individuals potentially belonging to different species. Other members of the same set are XC346483, XC346484 and XC346485.

recordings.loc: Chaidou, East Macedonia and Thrace, Makedonia Thraki

recordings.type: begging call, call, female, juvenile, male
recordings.rmk:
Male and female at nest with 
almost fledged chicks.

Now identified. This was recorded in a coniferous forest in South France. The calls that I couldn't identify are the loud shrill ones, now known to be black woodpecker (Dryocopus martius) calls. There is also a great spotted woodpecker and firecrest calling in the background. From what I could tell, the bird in question was sat in a conifer somewhere but I couldn't see it, and was a fair distance from me.
